intro: Pedicularis comosa var. acmodonta, commonly known as the woolly monkeyflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or red in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
